danushka sandaruwan tennakoon, Rajesh Jeewon, Kasun
Madhusanka Thambugala, Eleni Gentekaki, Dhanushka Nadeeshan Wanasinghe,
ITTHAYAKORN PROMPUTTHA, Kevin D Hyde
Title: Teichosporaceae
Keywords:
1 new species, Dothideomycetes, multi-locus phylogeny,
Pleosporales, sexual morph, taxonomy
Abstract:
The placement of the dothideomycetous family
Teichosporaceae has been controversial. Recent phylogenetic
investigations resulted in a taxonomic lumping approach with the
Floricolaceae and its genera being synonymized under the earlier family
name, Teichosporaceae. Intergeneric relationships were therefore obsure
and which morphs are phylogenetically significant in species delineation
warranted further studies. We here taxonomically revise the family
Teichosporaceae based on both morphology and phylogenetic evidence. Type
or representative specimens of Teichosporaceae were loaned and fresh
specimens were collected from China and Thailand. Maximum likelihood and
Bayesian analyses of a combined ITS, LSU, SSU, tef1-Î± and rpb2 dataset
were performed to clarify the phylogenetic affinities of the taxa. The
broad genus concept of Teichospora is dismissed based on morphological
dissimilarities and phylogenetic relationships among the genera. We
accept Asymmetrispora, Aurantiascoma, Floricola, Magnibotryascoma,
Misturatosphaeria, Pseudoaurantiascoma, Pseudomisturatosphaeria,
Ramusculicola and Teichospora as distinct genera in the Teichosporaceae.
All recognized genera are phenotypically characterized and
phylogenetically well-supported.
